name: evangelistically
content:
evangelistically adverb
(RELIGION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves persuading people to become Christians, often by travelling around and telling people about your beliefs: He came to preach evangelistically to the congregation. These churches sometimes struggle to be evangelistically effective.
More examplesFewer examplesI’m not evangelistically talented, so I felt very uncomfortable trying to convert people.They have been surprisingly active, both politically and evangelistically.

evangelistically adverb
(OPINIONS)
in a way that shows that you have very strong beliefs about something, or that involves persuading someone to have the same beliefs as you: He talks evangelistically about his work in the health sector. As an environmental group, they planned to lead the way evangelistically.
More examplesFewer examplesThe same arguments have been made elsewhere, though less evangelistically.The guides worked evangelistically to explain the site to visitors.
